page.title: 01Goathland Moor Area
page.content: The block is predominantly heather covered moorland, with a large area in the east covered in coniferous plantations. The moors drop fairly steeply to the south west towards the Eller Beck valley and Goathland. The extreme north east drops gently to the grass fields of the Little Beck valley. the are no residents in the block but the moors are used for bee keeping and grouse shooting as well as forestry. The main A169 passes through the block so the are is well used by tourists who stop to admire the scenery or by walkers on the potpaths. The moor are also used year round for sheep grazing.
